d-MhRpkSQHaT8WMBL77iLw.text: Chicken Latino is a clean establishment with a friendly wait staff and prices that can't be beat. My 1/4 Peruvian-style rotisserie chicken with Spanish rice and beans was only $6.50 (not to mention delicious)!!!! The rotisserie chicken is also the house specialty and does not disappoint. My side of fried plantains was great!

L83sgN_AvmiuU7jc23nIGw.text: Fantastic little find for this city. Try the rotisserie chicken with fried plantains on the side. We get ours to-go as the atmosphere is lacking but the food is worth popping in for. Affordable and filling. Tried the quesadilla once, which was good, but the fresh rotisserie chicken is where it's at here. We love this place.

uxmpGoF0_6Rgin2b-1-CLg.text: Good food and even better service.  Headed over to the Strip District Saturday with a friend and we decided to stop here for lunch.  There's a nice variety of foods available with a peruvian twist.  I had the chicken kabob with rice while my friend had a huge chicken quesadilla.  The chicken was a little on the dry side, but really flavorful and the rice was pretty decent.   Beverage options include mango and guava juices, Inca Cola, along with your standard Pepsi products (pretty sure it was Pepsi).  I had a piece of Tres Leches cake for dessert which was awesome!   Next time I'll try the plantains and the quarter-chicken.  Quick note about the service.  It was great!  You order your food at the counter and sit down and the food is brought out to you when it's ready.  The guys were very helpful and actually came by not only to check on our meal, but they also later cleared away our plates for us.  In addition to helping customers at the counter and in the dining room.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried Plantains
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Crispy Burrito
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tres Leches Cake

SjlTnWpdUWbxjKftcDootA.text: Got the 1/4 chicken and rice and beans. Chicken and rice have a great flavor. Green sauce is feet in the beans. Caution the sauce is really hot. Will be a regular spot for me.

T4HYQqyMhLlA_ssN90_Ssg.text: Soft Chicken Burrito.  Pretty good.  Fries were not too good (standard steak fries and probably same you can buy from supermarket).  Staff friendly and courteous.    The Peruvian chicken (whole or half) is also not bad.

QzZ-CbTJTFm6OFe0pXhA9Q.text: This is easily one of the cheapest places to eat in the city. Here are the things you have to know! 1) It is BYOB and they don't charge you per bottle. 2) a quarter chicken with no sides will cost you 3.99! 3) I don't recommend ordering off of the American portion of the menu or ordering the non-spicy salsa as it is not homemade like the spicy green salsa.  You can pass on the desserts, but don't pass on the chicken or the burritos.

Td1WQnZAkvEGQwM8PX8ZtA.text: Chicken Latino is one of the best places to eat in Pittsburgh.    We started with the fried plantains and they were amazing.  If you've never had them before, make sure to try them.  They are sweet, but so perfect as an appetizer.    I had the rotisserie chicken with beans and rice.  WOW!  This was amazing.  Perfectly cooked and seasoned.  It goes great with the rice, beans, and green chili sauce.  That sauce is amazing.  I put it on everything.    My wife had the crispy chicken burrito.  It was great.  She enjoyed it and she usually has trouble finding something that she likes.  Its a chicken and cheese burrito.....FRIED!  I had a couple of bites because i couldn't resist.    This place is awesome.  Good service, better price, and great food!

mkIgXhi2AFQM7T19uy8EjQ.text: I feel guilty after eating a fried chicken burrito. It has to be like 2,700 calories. Oh well it is delicious.  Its BYOB. They are known for their Peruvian chicken, but as I mentioned earlier I go her for the $5 gut bomb. The people are always nice. Before I came here I always thought this one of those restaurants in the strips that no one ever eats at. I put it at the bottom of my list until I went there the first time. Then after the seventh time I thought maybe its all the other restaurants in the strip that are now at the bottom of the list.

eA-5cYh2LcBPYDYRdawJ5g.text: They have the most awesome roasted chicken in the Burgh, hands down. I also love the plaintains and the yucca fries. The interiors are wonderfully ethnic and the server was a doll. Go!

LQ-yFQvXE0q0PTfps9UVzg.text: This place is an excellent place to go if you are in or around the Strip.  The food is delicious, prices are good, and staff is friendly.  Although i have only had the chicken, you cannot go wrong with it.  I have had the 1/2 chicken and also the crispy chicken burrito and both were very good.  In addition, I always get the yucca fries; my lunch order is now a burrito with yucca fries and all for under $10 and i can't finish it all.  In addition, always get the green sauce and use it to your heat tolerance.  It definitely has a kick to it, so mix it with some mayo especially for the yucca fries.  I don't know if I would drive out of my way to eat here, but it is worth going if you are close.

lFB5ZVO71-3EZY54aQKk9w.text: Wow!! I went to Chix Latino for lunch with Zero expectations, since there really isn't any good Mexican/Latino food here in the Burgh, I figured it would be a "Vanilla" experience. Was I wrong. I ordered Chips and Salsa and a Chix Buritto. The chips came out warm, but the salsa looked like it was Pace from a jar. The server also put down a squeeze bottle with a green, salsa style liquid in it. I decided to  squeeze a quarter sized amount on a chip..... BOOM!! It was flavor paradise!!! Then the heat came from out of nowhere!! That was it for me! I AM A FAN!   When the burrito came out I took a huge bite and it was awesome. The chicken had a very "Fresh, Clean" flavor. So I squirted some of this Green Love on my burrito...... I couldn't believe this jewel of restaurant is in my own back yard!!!  If you love mexican/latino food, then check this place out - you will not be disappointed!!!

r90ICQXbR0Te0pD7oSChQA.text: The "meh" may be my mistake...why did I order a quesadilla? Stil, who can't make a quesadilla? The answer is Chicken Latino! They put rice and beans and dry chicken in a flour tortilla and didn't use enough cheese. I understand that in Pittsburgh the goal is to put starch inside of starch and call it a day (fries in sandwiches etc), but that's not what I look for in a quesadilla. I look for QUESO!! I did order fried plantains and they were moist and delicious--what I look for in a plantain. I will go back and try the chicken. They are open till 8 which is (sadly) late for the strip.

5UyXyRgqlpBLVBhbb97ZPQ.text: Wonderful Peruvian style chicken!  This was one of H Ward's spots when he lived at the cork factory...legit chicken and get it w rice and blk beans.  Ask for a side of their "special green sauce" it kicks your butt!  Totally delicious and under $10.  It's also Byob btw.

KoKvnCSTjcGi0qRMC0s4eg.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat at the Strip. Grilled chicken (served every day) there is very tender and flavorful (well, most of the time :P) Ceviche and shredded pork (only available on weekends) are the best. For appetizer, grilled bananas is strongly recommended. Try chicha for drink. And rice pudding for desert :  )

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. chicken salad

-2APhEyMBPbQATqJYwI-4w.text: If I had kidnapped your first born, the ransom would be  chicken kabobs and fried burritos from Chicken Latino. I would also like 4 bottles of Inca Cola. Seriously though, whatever they marinate their kabobs in came directly from the brow of Jesus. I have been known to eat 5 kabobs in a row and then beg my wife for more as I wince through the pain,  unable to move from ingesting far too much chicken. The burritos are also tasty. I am a sucker for deep fried though.

2HJSj2nr5QzimdzkqvOn8Q.text: Don't be fooled by the plain decor and simple menu- this place seriously rocks.  You will not be disappointed with their roasted chicken.  And the funky green sauce that comes with it.  I eat here about 60% of shopping trips I make to the Strip.    And the price it right too.  Tip: ask for the white meat.

JTiUo2W2PQltxGrMc9iScg.text: Great, affordable place! Best yuca fries I've ever had. The rotisserie chicken was good but not as insanely flavorful as Pio Pio in NYC. The rice wasn't very tasty, and the soft chicken burrito was standard (it needs guacamole or something). I wouldn't order the burrito again. The flan was disappointing - too loose, watery and eggy. The plantains were naturally very sweet but not caramelized the way I like them to be. The real highlight however was the spicy green sauce, even better when mixed with mayo. The bf loved it mixed with ketchup! Will be back if I'm ever craving those delicious yuca fries.

KKE4wm2WzG-dB1ElbbMTnw.text: Ordered the 1/4 chicken with fries and coleslaw, and the crispy chicken burritos.  The only we can take it down were the fries, sodas, and the chicken.  The burritos was deep fried, nothing special, no taste...  The TV was too loud.

hNX1cmTw7GtBOkd1ZOd3Qw.text: I work in the Strip, so I need a good, healthy and hearty lunch before a busy day. Chicken Latino is one of the places I know I can go and get that. I've only eaten the chicken and the pork in their various forms on the menu but every time the meal I have is juicy, spicy and the perfect combination of flavors. The service is prompt and gracious, and the portions are more than generous--especially for the price. I'll certainly recommend this place to anyone. I eat here maybe three times a month, so that should be good enough review on its own.

UPrIDbL-q-pmKpX1ar04nA.text: Chicken Latino is a great addition to lunch spots in the Strip.   The owner is super-nice, and very happy to talk about her home country of Peru.   The portions are very large. I will never again make the mistake of ordering a quarter chicken and 2 sides just for myself... Plus, as others have said, the chicken is quite tasty. I look forward to trying the burritos.   My husband, a spicy food aficionado, would happily return if just for the little  plastic containers of green sauce. The waiter will warn you that it's spicy, and he's not kidding. A dab will do you.   Check it out next time you're in the Strip. The restaurant is big enough for groups and painted cheerily to remind you of warmer climes. Enjoy.

Tj8TyrumRnAGIQ_a-54mKA.text: Soooooo good!  Had the slow roasted pork. It was tender juicy deliciousness on a plate. Don't skip the fried plantains,  they're warm, ooey,gooey and great!

AZyAT4SZ6hkhx4U2mGwLZw.text: Cheap hole-in-the-wall Peruvian and Mexican food that is SOO yummy. Portions are HUGE, so plan on sharing. This is a great drunchies place - food is heavy and greasy and delicious. Of course, you can order lighter items and customize your dish. I got the chicken quesadilla, which was bigger than my face. And it was incredible. My boyfriend got the burrito, which was like 1.5x the size of a Chipotle burrito and probably cheaper. Definitely stop by if you're in the Strip!

PPSKD7Vz371S5yH7Rk0ZxA.text: Hum,, 95 reviews... what more can I add? I'd just like to concur with the current 4 star rating. I was quite satisfied with my lunch here today. I had the quarter chicken meal and the chicken was very moist, the rub gave it a unique but not over powering flavor and the "green sauce" gives it a great kick. The brown rice was plentiful and it combined nicely with the black beans.  Lunch of this quality for only $7.45 is a bargain!

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Quarter Chicken meal with rice and beans
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

4Vvb9mqw11FpdcRFn-CdEg.text: The Peruvian rotisserie chicken is delicious; their other items are ok but the chicken is the stand out dish, nicely seasoned and moist.

t72TeFcGlvM0HPjgQzLjew.text: Diamonds are not this girls best friend chicken is.   Another slam dunk,  home run out of the park meal.  It should also be noted that the restaurant was way more crowded then I had ever seen before. Good job Chicken Latino.  I am cheering for your success.    On this occasion my hubby of course got the shrimp and Tilapia  ceviche . Which is only served during the weekend as a lunch special.  The shrimp were plump and there was a massive amount of lime juice coating the fish and shrimp very nicely.    I had the half rotisserie chicken , no sides.  I didn't need any starches or legumes standing between me and that bird.  To the embarrassment of my boyfriend I ate the chicken with my bare hands tearing into it like a lion into a gazelle.  I was playing no games devouring my chicken.  Treat -yo-self to Chicken Latino you'll be happy you did.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Half Peruvian rotisserie chicken

IiQUqE_jORPMpkV0e3rpZQ.text: This Is simply the BEST! I love it here, by far my favorite joint in the strip. They provide quick service, exceptional food, and always a smile upon checkout. I get take out a couple times a week at Chicken Latino and I have never been disappointed! You guys are the best!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My favorite place in the strip can do no wrong! Amazing!
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. I&#39;m a regular here so I always know what to expect; AMAZING food! Muchas Gracias!

ejU3olO1nuTGbTcvAKb9-g.text: The food is consistently great here. I could live off their Yuca Fries!  It would be amazing if they could make a bread free version of their green sauce. That stuff is delicious, but seems like it would be easy to accommodate for those of us with food allergies.

BGyeovwlx1O3XWdDlJBHpA.text: I've always wanted to stop in this place since I first seen it but I don't know why it's taken me so long to finally eat here lol. But boy was I in for a treat! It's definitely one of my favorite spots. We ordered the plantains and a whole chicken with rice and beans and they had a delicious green chili sauce at the table that was also to die for! Spicy for most, but I love spicy so it was perfect. Service was nice and the food was out so quick. I can't wait to go back!

s0AfIl3SX7I8XrtGhnkSCw.text: Fans of the dearly departed George Aiken's have a new avenue for which to dine on roasted chicken.   Yeah, you wouldn't think you'd find such a thing at a Latin restaurant, but based on a recent visit, CL's cluckers are as moist, crackled, well-seasoned, and ideally prepared overall as I recall GA's being. Now that's what Kay had (1/4 of a chicken. They can be had in halves or wholes as well.).  I simply feasted on a massive deep-fried chicken burrito (named the Giant Crispy Chicken Burrito) that revealed juicy proteins, and gobs of liquefied cheddar once I got to the innards (it took a few bites). The outer tortilla resembled a sopapilla in both taste and texture. Inside was pure Mexican gastrobliss.   Dessert for me it was a square cut of Tres Leches Cake that that brought together rice pudding and tiramisu with its dairy-derived, candy-coated flavors.   Let's not omit the Soft Fried Plantains or the Yucca Fries from this narrative for they both offered a welcome diversion from standard french fries with their arch-starchiness, mild sugariness, and density.   I tried the Inka Kola as a beverage and found that it was essentially a more refreshing version of cream soda. I'll take a case of the stuff, gracias.   The service was inviting, the decor was vibrantly ethnic, and the prices were right for my budget. Try not to miss it when you're cruising through The Strip. Psst. Look for the sign with the arrow.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tres Leches Cake
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Interiors
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Giant Fried Crispy Chicken Burrito

wgt84Z1Jbde5JXRpqZvpvQ.text: Good chicken, but not amazing.  The chicken was well-cooked and tender, but not to the level of flavor and smokiness that you get in other Peruvian chicken places.  The rice was very good, and it passed the authenticity test by a friend who just got back from Panama.  If you plan to stop here, do so at lunch time.  They ran out of chicken at dinner time trying to serve us.

jJsrK67NNeahPibZ7c9Qpw.text: I went with my husband and we loved everything there, specially the tostones! Sooo good!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Great latin food! Everything is soo good!!

PkROI5n9lbqVE3HN89583w.text: This is my 5th or 6st visit here and every trip is a pleasure. The food has the flavor of a high end restaurants but the feel of a blue collar eatery. the menu is simple as long as you know what Latin food consists of. And the servers are attentive enough but in a place like this you just want to enjoy your food your friends and the convo.  I love places with great food without pretense. I mean I love farm to table local sourced as much as any foodie but some times I don't care if it was free range raised by farmer John seasoned with 15 seasonings and slow roasted over cherry wood and lava rocks from Krakatoa. some times I just want good roast chicken with great rice and black beans and a side of plantains.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Qi7VqTtfEoZl-RV15L_xMQ.text: I wasn't impressed with the menu. Only one item I consider Peruvian was the roast chicken. Plantains were great. Most of the menu was quesadilla and burritos which were huge so if you want a lot of food at a low price this might be for you, but won't recommend if you are looking for Peruvian food.

71I3acz1D2ANWHtWyyUP6A.text: Chicken Latino was a wonderful surprise!   Service was fast and friendly, but most importantly, the food was really well prepared - flavorful and succulent. The taste and texture of the food was impressive.   My companion's rotisserie chicken was delicate and moist, immaculately seasoned and cooked. A great gluten-free option for someone with Celiac Disease.   It being our first food stop back in Pittsburgh, I got a salad with grilled chicken, fries, and shredded cheddar, a dish well known to the region, that I had long craved.   And wow, this was the best one I'd ever have.  I highly recommend Chicken Latino, and I will be back again next time I visit Pittsburgh.

iwl3gWsIgZSDiNc84dbIsA.text: I have been to this place since day one 8 years ago!! I no longer live in town, but every time I come home the food is just as authentic, consistent and delicious as the million times before! I used to eat here regularly for 4 years straight. I had lunch here yesterday and fell back in love with all of my favorites like the sweet fried plantains, tres leche cake, rice pudding, their moist flavor packed rotisserie chicken and the absolute BEST CHICKEN QUESADILLA you will ever have in your life!!!   This quesadilla is at least an inch thick with large portions of moist rotisserie chicken, cheese, rice and beans. The heartiest quesadilla you will every have in your life! I live next to Mexico and I can't even get them this good! If you're in the area and craving some good homemade food, look no further!! Must eat here!

aFsXiMsCMf9eLQdlDbJ0nw.text: Chicken Latino has a good chicken meal, similar to Boston Market. Their burritos are just OK. They tend to be slow when they have a few customers but very fast when the place is empty.

-ck14m7eSoH-_nLphmW_dw.text: Classic Peruvian rotisserie chicken spot. Stopped in for lunch. Service is very fast, almost had food before we sat down. Get the chicken with fries, don't waist the space in your stomach with the rice and beans. Green sauce was awesome.

0yAFQ9gTI5ikhGBxF8yM3Q.text: Chicken Latino. We finally stopped in on a Monday. We ordered the half chicken, rotisserie style, we also ordered the rice and beans, and of course the fried Plantains. $14.50. The half chicken arrived and we shared it. The rub flavor on the chicken was amazing, I would love the recipe. The chicken was succulent moist and just fell apart on the plate. Grocery store rotisserie chicken, I am embarrassed for you. Chicken Latino's rotisserie chicken has put you to shame. If I am ever in the strip District shopping, I will stop and get a whole rotisserie chicken to bring home. Next time I eat there, I will order the chicken quesadilla. Fabulous food, I highly recommend, will definitely go back.

ke7u_fieB3YxDqF7O0yyMA.text: Definitely coming here again and trying different things on their menu. Their Tres Leches is exactly what everyone on Yelp claimed to be- freakndelicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Giant Crispy Burrito. Yup! Yummy!!
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Excellent 3&#39;s Leche Cake

Wo7WlJo7oSXAQhfE6i5obw.text: Chicken Latino has been on my list of things to do for quite awhile.  The problem is that I usually make my way to the Strip District earlier in the morning and I'm home by 10am while Chicken Latino only opens at 11am.  But one Friday I went down a bit later than I usually do and hit up all the hot spots before ending up here for lunch promptly at 11:05am.  The menu is pretty basic, not overwhelming.  I kept it simple and went for the Giant Crispy Chicken Burrito and Yucca Fries.  The $4 price tag on the fries seemed a bit steep until I saw the portion.  After eating my deep fried burrito, I could barely touch the fries and saved most of them for later.    The staff and decor are welcoming and I thoroughly enjoyed my selections.  That burrito was delicious portions of chicken and cheese inside the most amazing crunchy goodness.  And the yucca fries, well, they were good even when reheated.  I will definitely go back to try something new and if this first taste is any indication, I shan't be disappointed.

aqg1mMApP7eP7FzftDm8MA.text: This little restaurant might be a bit hard to discover, but after you have experienced their quality, you'll question how you ever lived without it!  They have by faaaaaar, the best chicken quesadillas in western PA. If you catch them at just the right time, they also have a BBQ beef brisket quesadilla  that is more addictive than most narcotics... Seriously.   Treat yourself...

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The best chicken quesadilla in pgh... HANDS DOWN
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried plantains!!!  They were spectacular mmmmmm relish

1Rn-jKw-_P21iaVSBCCW0g.text: Went here on a cold, wet night in January and we all found solace in their shop of chicken.   My friends both got the 1/2 chicken with a side of fries and coleslaw and finished them both. They also got a side of sweet plantains while I got the 1/4 chicken with a side of fried yucas.    I actually thought the chicken was alright, slightly better than the giant eagle rotisserie chicken.  I agree with prior customers, the green chili sauce made it worth the while. I actually thought their fries were better than the fried yuca.  It was more dense and chewy than it's counterpart and lacked in flavor.  The fried plantains were amazing and I would definitely recommend getting them! The price was insanely cheap and so we left happy and significantly bloated.

4fkkhgjaLQHxk43vEGAkSQ.text: This is a nice spot for a quick affordable meal in the Strip.   Chicken is excellent with South American spicing.   I had it with black beans and Cole slaw.  The black beans were great mixed with a very spicy green chili salsa.  Cole slaw was perfect to cool the palate.  Serve plates to go allowing for eating and sightseeing,  but not without proof of green chile on my new Penguins sweatshirt.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Front door

xrkntrVSdtM9OTB1rx0vtA.text: Everything is very good. The staff is very nice and attentive. By far the best meal is the roasted Peruvian chicken. Quesadillas are huge.

FkwHdi80NnjmnMEF5EPt-w.text: I came here with my husband and brother for dinner and we thought this place was just OKAY. Nothing to write home about. I had a burrito bowl that was heavy with rice and beans. It was alright but I couldn't finish it and didn't want to take it home. It wasn't bomb enough for me. My husband said his quesadilla taste plain but tasted much better once he added the sour cream. Customer service was good but I wouldn't come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. My burrito bowl
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Plain nachos and regular ole salsa

_9MrPrgascT8cdj0n4g4Hg.text: I loveeeee Chicken Latino! I've been looking for Peruvian places in Pittsburgh for awhile. When I first moved here, I was in the phase of obsessing over Peruvian chicken and yuca fries, so this has become my goto dinner place on the weekend. The price is so reasonable, and I always leave here with my stomach happy, and have some leftover with me for the next day. I brought so many different friends to try this place, everyone seems to love it. The only suggestion I will give is I wish Yucca fries or plantain can be options for the sides. I really only want chicken and yucca fries, but I always got to pick a side so I do double rice and an order of yucca fries. Anyway, if you are hesititating on trying this place, just do it :D But make sure you read their hours first before you go, because they do close really early most days.

OnXhFNeuhA1eYjBh5c1tzg.text: So this place doesn't need another glowing review, but I'm back from a 5 year Yelping hiatus, and this is one of my favorite restaurants EVER, so dammit, I'm going to heap on yet more praise for this Strip District eatery.  Chicken Latino pretty much embodies the idea of focusing on one thing (chicken!!) and doing it right.  I absolutely adore their Peruvian chicken...so moist, tender, flavorful, delicious. And their yummy spanish rice and creamy black bean sides.  And their crispy chicken burrito... OMG....pulled chicken and gooey cheese in a fried, light crispy shell.  And let's not forget to douse everything in their amazing spicy, tangy, citrus-y, cilantro-y green sauce.  Ohhhhhh, the green sauce.  Yeah, I'm drooling on my laptop.  Just go. Go now.

FRtOd68Qh5BMB7OCnnpt0w.text: A True hidden gem in Pittsburgh. I've had my fair share of Latino food but this place really takes the cake. I highly recommend the pulled pork (SO TENDER) and definitely coat it with the green sauce they provide. Their yuca fries are awesome, as are their quesadillas and ...well pretty much everything. If you eat the yuca fries, ask for mayo and mix it with the green sauce~best dipping sauce evaaa  That being said...does anyone know what is in the green sauce?

2em-rYkUwqavNh9C6WzR4A.text: Recommended by a Peruvian friend. Chicken , French fries and spicy sauce are all good . Just wish the mango juice can be improved. Will visit next time !

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

5_fzXh7b6eFOgOSgn5PNlw.text: Big fan. The first time I had the Rotisserie Chicken and it was awesome. The next visit I ordered the quesadilla and burrito to go. Definitely recommend this place.

yo3uvMK23bSJrIAvHe8cMw.text: Excellent burrito, I couldn't finish it. The chicken is awesome. Whatever that green sauce is, I loved it. Very spicy. I will be back.

TBWv-TWxacOnreppX8rw2Q.text: The price : perfect. The food : delicious. The service : fast.  We've gotten this place to cater for my company meetings 5 or so times now.  Must have: Plantains As many chickens as you can cram in your face.

39rZ9gHv-af5Es6DnrCbYQ.text: I'm a huge fan of Peruvian-Style rotisserie chicken, and Chicken Latino didn't disappoint.  The service was expedient, and the cost for the large portion of 1/4 chicken, with fries and coleslaw was unbeatable.  The gentleman who took my order later asked if I needed anything else.  I replied "No, but the house-made spicy sauce was used for both the chicken and the fries."  I love spicy food, and it was definitely worth the visit.

W4t4Y3RJN3mU47eE7C4Jmg.text: Delicious. absolutely delicious! I love Central and South American food, but usually you can only find Mexican food in the area. I got the 1/4 chicken combo with rice and beans. The chicken had amazing flavor (expect rotisserie style), the beans were amazing, and the rice was pretty good. They have yuca and plantain, but unfortunately no cream to dip it in. Otherwise absolutely amazing.   On a side note, not sure if this is a waitress system or what. I had my order taken and food plus bill delivered, but no refill offer or anything like that.

8P8jJzTE2bQOEw_zlHkl3Q.text: Friendly, welcoming service. Food is amazing especially for the price and the portions are huge. Big fan!

-fRv0PKPV7DEUqsin2fFSA.text: We came here with two small children during a Pittsburgh Open Streets event on a recommendation from a friend.  The food was interesting and delicious and the staff were friendly and happy to accommodate our family at a sidewalk table.   I had the quarter chicken, beans and rice and wife had the ceviche. The chicken had been marinated and cooked to flavorful tender perfection. I think my wife was expecting the ceviche to be diced instead of chunked but it was flavorful no less. We had a fried plantain appetizer that came very quickly.  The green sauce condiment was spicy and was a great companion for the chicken beans and rice. Prices reasonable for the large portions.   Given the Open Street event, I was surprised and happy to find the empty large sidewalk table available to us during lunchtime.

O4nTA6vqKQBKgnjE5Vun6w.text: More Mexican the Peruvian. Chicken could use more spice flavor. Most Peruvian Restaurants you can smell the roasting chicken , not here. More like a Chipoltle with an Am style roast chicken option Not an authentic Peruvian chicken or restaurant  In my opinion. Won't go back

OI0WRjfHOEBqODYGZPRcsw.text: Great place for some good eats and very filling without breaking the bank. Crispy burrito, chicken salad, and chicken quesadilla are all no brainers here. Fast service and BYOB. I'm also usually one to judge a place on their ranch dressing and theirs is perfect for the fries or salad. Always need the green sauce on everything!

fC03uq4kuzWrBXPnS5pKUQ.text: This place has the best chicken in Pittsburgh. No matter which dish you get, get it with chicken. They marinate it perfectly.   Cozy environment and great prices.

DyORnNxIEQMhmEE48q3zcg.text: * The chicken, rice and beans were great 8/10 would fux with those again.  * Green sauce was super tasty and pretty spicy 9/10. * DO NOT get the ceviche. It is terrible. I know you're not supposed to expect great seafood in Pittsburgh, but the ceviche at Ceviche downtown is amazing. Should have trusted my instincts and gotten the slow roasted pork instead.

JshgL-YiO3xHNrW2IrMO1w.text: Chicken Latino is a comfortable joint in the Strip District. Its not common to have a place in Pgh that specializes in chicken, aside from lip service, but Chicken Latino owns it.  Their menu is succint and clear, a good thing for a starving diner that doesnt want to read 20 pages to figure out dinner. I cannot comment on the apps, as I ordered the 1/2 chicken dinner with rice and beans.   All of it was delicious, and you get a TON of food for what you pay. I think my meal was the same price as some sort of gastro-death that is a Wendys meal. It was also leagues better. The chicken is perfectly spiced and extremely tender. The spices permeate throughout the meat and you are given a bottle of green chili sauce to liberally pour all over everything if you choose. It is spicy and delectable.   I will return for a simple, awesome meal.

sfZurrE8rFQ6vB4iXl8n7w.text: Peruvian chicken is one of the tastiest ways to eat chicken ever.  It's marinated overnight in a blend of herbs and seasonings and then slow roasted to result in super tender and flavorful meat.  In Pittsburgh there are two places to get Peruvian chicken; AJ's Peruvian in Oakland and Chicken Latino in the Strip District.  Both places serve up super tasty chicken, but there are slight differences in their marinade which make them slightly different.  I always get a half chicken minimum; I gotta have my dark meat!  They also have more Americanized dishes as well as Mexican dishes, but when I go to Chicken Latino I order chicken.  On weekends they also serve up roast pork and ceviche, which is suppose to be really good as well (I have yet to try them).  I would recommend not only Chicken Latino but also all Peruvian chicken out there in the world.  Check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Peruvian Chicken w/ Jalapeno Poppers

RV_f2HpTasuKTs3GnVlaqA.text: Delicious tender chicken, and yummy sweet plantains and yucca fries.  Black beans and rice were both fine, but nothing special.  But the service was friendly and fast.  Overall, I definitely recommend this place.

MP4zdPtkhTk54O2gZSyDEw.text: Absolutely delicious as well as affordable!  We got the special of the day (slow cooked pork) with spanish rice and black beans ($8) as well as a side of fried yucca ($4) and plantains ($3).  The food came out quickly and was pipping hot and well as flavorful. I loved the green sauce. Mixing it with some mayo was the perfect dip for the yucca.  We couldn't finish it so we took the left overs home and had dinner as well! $15 for two meals for two people is pretty swell.

diG64nRSOpVa79GxHb0O9w.text: After walking by this place every time we go to the strip, we finally decided to try it instead of a street vendor style lunch. I had the chicken with rice and beans. The chicken was tender but not as flavorful as I was expecting. It definitely needed paired with the delicious spicy green sauce on the table. The rice and beans were a little bland but tasted good with sauce. My husband had the pork with rice. The pork was really tender. We sat outside and I think they forgot about us for a while. I'd come back to try the yucca fries - wish we would've gotten them.

YD7vj-U9oOSUsOQW09LrjQ.text: I'm thankful that my co-workers introduced me to Chicken Latino on a recent lunch outing. I have been craving the rotisserie chicken and the bright green chile sauce in the squeeze bottle it comes with ever since my first visit. I've been back a few times since then and it's been perfect every single time.  The chicken is so delicious - perfectly seasoned and perfectly cooked. I easily took out the quarter chicken with rice and beans and plantains on the side. The green chile sauce is perfect on everything. That sauce is just as delicious as the chicken and it's a balanced tasty-hot counterpoint to the entree.  On a Sunday lunch after church with my family, we did the whole chicken, rice and beans and fried plantains. A great meal at a great price ($20 altogether).  This place is great for kids, the service is very friendly and attentive, prices are great and the food is delicious. What's not to love about this place?

0Qs0fPRWi-K9mkOMKKUimA.text: Chicken Latino is our favorite restaurant, especially in summer when the fresh fruit slushes are available. We have never had a bad meal. We love everything! I wish they had lomo during the week. Thatbisxobe request. The food is always got, fresh and very reasonably priced. We love taking our friends here.

R5aNCuQm7kMi0hExgtyQEQ.text: I discovered this restaurant when I googled Latino restaurants in Pittsburgh a year ago. The very first forkful of the chicken, rice, black beans and my favorite of all, sweet fried plantains was an explosive flavorful experience that I've enjoyed many times since.  The food is fresh, very flavorful and reasonably priced.  The staff are vet accommodating too.  I highly recommend Chicken Latino, and would be happy if they'd open a few more locations in the Eastern , Western , Northern  and Southern parts of Pittsburgh.

1BGFkkYe5nZ1W3-1PwrSwQ.text: We had a whole chicken with (seasoned) rice and beans, fried plantains and fried yuca today. Everything was delicious! I grew up eating Peruvian chicken and I can tell you their chicken tastes authentic. We also ordered drinks. It was a lot of amazing food and we only spent $36!! I'm sure we'll become regulars!!

5EV5_GRCkwhsmCmOTXFJrA.text: Loved their crispy chicken burrito with the green sauce (spicy, cilantro-y goodness). Fried plantains were just okay.

YRi0SuVaCaHYsJcilu7Bow.text: Chicken is actually marinated chicken cooked in a brick oven. Not your typical rotisserie chicken. The owner is underselling a great product by calling it on his menu and website "rotisserie". Really tasty, attractive flavor, not dripping oil/ fat like typical store rotisserie. Sides: black beans are to die for. Yucca fries are delicious especially dipped in their freshly made sauce. Plantain fries are a nice sweet finish. Steak fries are the best I tried in a while. Fast service. We got our food in 2 minutes! All in all, great food, modest price, and a joint that may not be your choice for a romantic evening on the town but certainly a place where the family would eat a hearty meal. Open till 8 pm on Fridays. A great plus considering that the whole Strip area closes at 4 pm.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brick oven baked (marinated) chicken  with Yucca, potato and plantain fries. Fab!!

Vqr_9VwwY-uhH6C6OpDtwg.text: Ive come here a few times for lunch on my lunch break... People really love this place at work and so does my boyfriend however I don't think it's anything special. It's pretty good but I don't think there's enough options on the menu and it's kinda just whatever food... I've had the quesadilla and burrito on two different occasions. I love the atmosphere though; I studied abroad in Ecuador and it definitely reminds me of every restaurant there which I love seeing that in pittsburgh!

o2WvBr-WAU_RdBZlLRAQ7g.text: How did I never review this??  Seriously. I love this place!  I first hit CL at lunch with some coworkers when I was working down in the Strip.  They so raved about it - and they are not "ethnic" eaters - that I had to try it.  All I can say is "oh my".  This burrito was both quantity and quality.  It was overstuffed with rice, black beans, this fantastic Peruvian chicken, and cheese.  I realized immediately that this burrito was fantastically tasty and, unfortunately, too much for one lunch..... so I polished the entire thing off anyway.  It took twice as long to walk back to work as it did to get there.... but it was so worth it.   And, for less than the price of a fast-food burger, I was in burrito heaven.  So, of course, then it was a matter of taking DH there on a weekend.  We had been walking the strip for hours and were famished having skipped breakfast and lunch and it was late afternoon, so we ordered heartily - he got a burrito, I ordered a quesadilla, and we split a bowl of tortilla soup along with an order of nachos.  I don't know what they do to their salsa but, damn, it is tasty.  It has such a nice light kick to it - not enough to keep your tongue burning, just enough to make it tasty - and those chips. I don't know. Maybe they dust them with crack cocaine - they are totally addictive.  I don't know what makes them so good but they truly are fantastic.    The quesadilla was HUGE. And stuffed nicely with chicken, rice, black beans, and cheese .  1/2 of it came home and the teenager ate it later.  The tortilla soup was very good.  Nicely spiced.  Not too junked up with stuff (I hate when they throw so much cheese and strips on the top that you feel like you are eating the Mexican version of French onion soup).    Having hit it several times since then for lunch, we made it down again over the weekend with DH and TS before the Pittsburgh Power game - and we heartily dug in and enjoyed our meal immensely.    The waitstaff is friendly and fun - they are attentive and helpful when you are ordering.  Prices are soooo reasonable.  There are not many places where you can feed three adults - with a lot of leftovers to go home - for about $10-12 a person.  And we could have easily spent less if we didn't want the leftovers - but what fun would that be???  I hate to recommend this place because I hate to see it become crowded like that place across the street on weekends ;)  but I have to share this place - it is so good and they deserve to be a huge success.  So go and enjoy -

OUE4jOES5aZz8SkPQYEm7g.text: I absolutely love this place! I had the chicken quesadilla and it was freakin' huge! I also ordered the fried plantains which where also really good. I cannot recommend this place enough!

h7GfGCRPjowDK_My0lsAcQ.text: So, so good. I like their chicken enchiladas especially. The green hot sauce is also really good for someone that likes their food spicy.

jI172wtBUobJETpOZRLWkw.text: Great experience here. Service and staff were friendly and great. We couldn't decide what to get, so we ordered quarter chicken with rice and beans and a chicken burrito and split it (2 people). We had food leftover. Everything was great tasting. The bathroom was not the cleanest, but it was acceptable.  We wished we would have ordered the specials that they had going on at the time, which the table next to us ordered. Honestly can't remember what they were, but they looked great, so take a risk and order them next time. We love the atmosphere in the Strip District in general. The doors/windows are usually open and it's a very casual atmosphere. Would go back and try new things. Prices are good for the portions.

2EnwfdxYUm4cjH9sCRMSdg.text: Another awesome meal at Chicken Latino!! The prices are good, the service quick and efficient, and the food...ah the food! The last time we were here we tried the whole chicken, and it was delicious. Fresh and falling off the bone, it melts in your mouth. Try it with a dribble of their special sauce (trust me, a bit is all you need!), and you will be in heaven. The chips are fresh and crispy, and the homemade salsa has just enough kick to it. We washed it down with excellent hot cinnamon tea (we were there in the winter). The second time we went we both ordered the slow roasted pork with rice, beans, and fries. The pork was amazing, and quite tender and moist. Try it with the sauce as well! The fries were also good, but the rice is just standard, so I left most of that on my plate. But, the generous helping of pork kept me happy. Definitely check this place out the next time you are in the Strip District!

rxy_EyFtDU2aaUJG8OMCcw.text: This place is literally the best food I've had in a long time, amazing service, I couldn't have asked for a better experience

pfBMFfOS6edYqiSvsOX8TA.text: I work just up the street and can honestly say I eat here more than any other place in the Strip. While others restaurants are tourist traps and overpriced. Chicken Latino has always delivered awesome food and portions for a reasonable price. The green sauce.....dont get me started, I can guzzle it! I love the burritos (sour cream& salsa inside...specify when ordering), the pgh chicken salad, yucca, lomo, and ceviche are mu favoritess. Always a friendly staff and good food. I always recommend this place to my customers and friends....if youre hungry, go here!!!!

m3PLOaqeEC3Y8PzSHqdK_Q.text: The green sauce is incredible.  Don't go for a burrito, there are much better items on the menu.  You won't leave hungry.

A9LanCcrMlhEOIRvR90HlQ.text: On a winters day in Pittsburgh when the windchill is in the negatives and snow is falling; there are a few things more satisfying and comforting than a warm chicken dinner. Or lunch in my case. I work down the street from Chicken Latino and it is a place I have passed many times in the strip district but unfortunately had never entered. Immediately upon entering this establishment you can tell that it is somewhere that you want to dine. The signage is colorful the dining room is clean and the smell is amazing.   I ordered the 1/4 chicken with a side of rice and beans. My total came to less than $10, which admittedly made me wonder how much food I would get.  However when I receive my to go box the weight of it put those fears to rest. My food came out of the kitchen in less than 10 minutes, which is appreciated when you're pressed for time during the lunch break. I requested extra of the "green sauce" (aji picante) and headed back to work. This is a meal that your coworkers will envy. They give you enough rice to feed a small country. The chicken is super moist, tender and delicious. And the beans are really just an extra bonus that tie the meal together. The only thing I can think to compare this meal to is a warm hug.   Chicken Latino is definitely one is Pittsburgh's not so hidden gems. It is a place that you could pretty much take anyone, because who doesn't love chicken? The speedy and attentive service makes it a great place to go on a lunch break but the size of the meals would make it a great dinner spot as well. Chicken Latino does a great job at serving up authentic Peruvian food to Pittsburghers and any tors that might visit the Strip District. I will definitely be visiting again!

vVnZ5DWLYLdk7XbHlTXZBw.text: Really good food, and lots of it, for the price. The fried plantains were excellent.  My son absolutley loved the quarter chicken, and I thought the veggie quesadilla was great. The spicy green sauce is hot, but not too hot, and has a good flavor. The server was easant and took the time to explain things to us. The atmosphere is nothing fancy, but it's clean and comfortable.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

qjPgl_Q4OW47Lr4HxXbg4w.text: Should not be classified as Peruvian cuisine. A lot of the menu options are far from Peruvian dishes.

37C71d8krNxQVk2khF8ZZA.text: Stopped in for lunch after shopping in the strip - so glad we did!  The menu has something for everyone. There were 3 people up front working and before we left every single one of them had helped us in some way. I have NEVER had pork this good!!! The servings were large and even after bringing home leftovers and reheating, the pork was still amazing. Great place, great people!

1px4Juv3S7V1vGc5NtV5TQ.text: Food was delicious. The chicken was great and we loved the friend plantains. The green chili sauce they serve with the chicken is spicy but good.   It's fairly friendly on the pocketbook as well. We were able to spilt an appetizer and 1/4 of chicken entree and it was just the right amount to fill us up and we didn't have to carry around a leftovers container around the strip district

YWNZC5awPTsWPqflMrbEYw.text: Peruvian chicken is the focus for Chicken Latino, so unless you are vegetarian you might as well try something with chicken -- if you're not in the mood for a huge hunk of chicken, then maybe try a soft chicken burrito or chicken quesadilla. First a bit of a warning though -- the portions are huge so unless you are starving, you will have trouble finishing the quesadilla or burrito on your own. Either split, plan to take leftovers home, or eat too much and leave feeling slightly sick which is what I usually make the mistake of doing. Note that (somewhat surprisingly) the quesadilla is actually a lot more food than the burrito.  My favorite tried-and-True menu option is the soft chicken burrito, but the green hot sauce which comes in a squeeze bottle on the table is the real star of the meal. If you like spicy food,  make sure to squirt it liberally on your burrito. If not, still try a little because it is delicious. Note that the hot sauce (strangely) has bread in it, so be aware if you are gluten sensitive.  Although it's not listed on all the menus, it's also possible to get a "naked" burrito bowl and then add hot corn tortillas on the side. This would make a good option to split with a friend. It's also possible to add onions and peppers to your burrito or bowl.  Other standout items include the fried plantains appetizer, and tres leches cake for dessert.  Overall this is a decent restaurant, super casual, and good value for the amount of food you get.

-EpILLH05Z_i8Mp_FECIYQ.text: Chicken Latino is hugely underrated. I'm always surprised when I hear people say they haven't heard/eaten here. Such was the case last week when myself and three friends gathered here for dinner the day after Chicken Latino was closed due to their protest against the immigration ban. *sigh* We intentionally came here to support your amazing food and wonderful staff.   I ordered the chicken quesadilla and yuca fries, would recommend. Two others ordered the 1/4 rotisserie chicken with rice and black beans and the last person in my party ordered the giant fried burrito. We barely spoke as we ate outside of our grunts to pass the "green sauce." Our waitress was so kind and gave us a tip: mix the green sauce with mayo and try it on the yuca. Delish!!   I'll echo other comments and say the portions are large and I ended up taking half my food home. Reheated two days later in the oven and just as tasty!   Thank you Chicken Latino for existing and being so consistently delicious!

V6xytq_8uRwa0bqgSzjQpg.text: I question how on this burrito-loving earth it's possible to serve food 1) so delicious and fresh 2) so reasonably priced 3) in such generous portions... It's a mystery I keep going back to investigate!  A sanctuary for authentic, flavorful food lovers, sweet plantain fiends, and the really hungry people coming down from the rush of Strip District shopping, this festively decorated space is bright and inviting... Essentially, the effect is like walking into a fiesta. The portions suggest you could definitely share an entree; However, you probably won't want to. Go extra hungry and you MIGHT be able to polish off one of the massive burritos. I'm personally very into the bright green sauce you can request for your grub. USE CAUTION, it is the special kind of hot that sneaks up on you and embraces you in a tongue-numbing hug. If you like that sort of thing, you can get a container for home.   There's so much to love at Chicken Latino, absolutely give this hidden gem a try next time you're in the Strip!

021fnctM0z_OmlejOr2vEQ.text: Tbh, Chicken was a bit bland to me. I'm celiacs so I was regulated to chicken w/ rice and beans. All were on the blander side w/ the chicken being the best of the 3. Staff was nice but a bit inattentive.

R_tra8Oq59bkHDNzCwawCA.text: Food is worth it's price. Good customer service.  Whether it's better than chipotle is debatable.

dR70N9b2_fbxyxmYbI1Qrg.text: When they said this is the best chicken in town I didn't think much of it. Until we dropped in for lunch. The food is simple but superb. The chicken is prepared daily to perfection. The side dishes are LATIN American fantastic. Tip: go on a Friday or Saturday to order the roast pork - it's off the charts!

phQtwmnn3pHUMFT_z4UJjQ.text: I absolutely adore this place!!! I have been going here for years and the food is always out of this world. I always end up leaving very happy and look forward to the days when i can get over to The Strip to enjoy it. Nearly every time, I get the soft chicken burrito. The fried burrito is also delicious (but I don't do well with fried) The green sauce is impeccable. I usually add some to sour cream and then dip absolutely everything into it! It's especially awesome on yucca fries. I love being able to add either onions or grilled peppers into my burrito depending on my mood. And of course the plantains for dessert are a must. Now I just need to get all of my Greentree coworkers as hooked as I am so that I can convince them to drive down for lunch ;-)

77ay9SZMVgdQT3cGO4yAoQ.text: We need to talk about Chicken Latino.  A friend recommended it to me when I first moved to the city. I got 1/4 chicken and rice and I thought "wow, this is actually really good." Then I started getting their quesadillas. These things are HUGE and taste AMAZING! One day, I was really in the mood for some chicken and fries, so I ordered their chicken sandwich, not really expecting much. Boy, was I wrong! Even that was amazing!  The staff here is also super friendly. They have never been anything short of kind and welcoming, even when they're slow during the day.   I recommend Chicken Latino all the time to people visiting the Strip District. Come to think of it, it's been a while since I've been there. I need to make a trip soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken quesadilla, Spanish rice, &amp; chips and salsa

TqjUfFyAv-txB20eHX2v4A.text: Ate here one time and thought the food was good. Went back to take my son and his college roommates and the young manager was such a jerk! With all the great restaurants in the strip I will never waste my time or money here again! Spoke to some friends who had the same experience from this young guy and they won't go back either.  I went across the street to Reynas!  Remember,  it starts with just one customer, then another and soon you're out of business because of the way you treat people.

kM5l4A-5aQOOA6Rmx-pLtA.text: Found this place by chance. They were just starting to open for the day. We ordered the fried plantains. Awesome!!! Their chicken is super good.  Their green sauce though ... What is in that awesomeness?!? We wanted to douse everything with it. I can't understand though how so many people could keep walking by & not want to try this place. The service was good; they were attentive. The food came out quickly. Loved the food. Prices were decent.  Totally would come back every time I'm in Pittsburgh!!!

4e9cYsc7RSG8YFRABJkSjw.text: Fried plantains and burritos.  Gotta get the green sauce.

zbYq3r0bCEC0qZ1R27kppw.text: If you're looking for an inexpensive, tasty lunch in the Strip at a sit down restaurant, give Chicken Latino a try!  I came here for lunch today with a friend, and we ordered the half Peruvian rotisserie chicken, yucca fries, and fried plantains, which was more than enough for the two of us.  I also had a bottle of Inca Cola, which I hadn't had since studying abroad in Quito in 2006.  We enjoyed the chicken, which I found tender and well-seasoned, particularly on the skin, particularly with the green sauce, which we mixed with mayo to cut the spiciness.  The yucca fries were also great with the sauce.  I wasn't as much of a fan of the plantains (too sweet), but this is probably an idiosyncratic matter, since I don't really care for bananas much.  All this food set us back about $20, which is pretty inexpensive for a sit down meal, though there is cheaper street food to be had nearby.  Our waiter was friendly and helpful, helping us make decisions by making  suggestions.  I also enjoyed the wall hangings, which reminded me of the textiles available at indigenous markets in Ecuador.  One suggestion for improvement would be to have mayo available in squeeze bottles, similar to the green sauce, since tearing open packets is a pain and creates unnecessary waste.  Other than that, nice job and thanks for an enjoyable lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Half rotisserie chicken and yucca fries
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried plantains
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. You can get Inca Kola with your meal here

6bdPRp-7DUa4ilvZkTImIg.text: Love their chicken! Cheap, fast and most important of all the good things that I can say about this place is everything they have are mind blowing delicious.

6_B_z89L-aUV1TqRkMedfg.text: I wasn't too amused with the chicken plate. It wasn't anything special. It would have been incredibly bland if it wasn't for their green sauce. Green sauce saves all! Oh and the cole slaw definitely didn't seem fresh. But the fries. Goodness, let me talk about them fries! It was so delicious! It was made hot to order. I'm usually not to fond of thick cut fries, but these fries were fried perfectly so that there was a nice crunch throughout each bite!  If you're at Chicken Latino- get the Lomo Saltado! The seasoning was quite different from the one I'm used to- but they embraced the dish and made it work. The same awesome fries were used for the lomo saltado as well!

yi8gL0tt8RPe9fv6bXm9MA.text: I was recommended to try this restaurant by a few close friends who really spoke highly of the chicken burrito. My mom is a vendor in the strip and when I went to visit her one Saturday we decided to order take out from here for dinner.   We ordered 3 chicken burritos to go and I have to say they were quick with putting these together; we were out in no time. These burritos are pretty massive in size and come packed with lots of chicken, rice and cheese (i left out the beans). The price is definitely reasonable for how much food you get! The sad part of the meal was it lacked flavor and the chicken was on the dry side. I'm not sure if maybe they were having an off day or if we just ordered the wrong thing on the menu since other yelpers seem to love the rotisserie chicken. I would consider giving this restaurant another try because I do not want to rule it out just yet.

PmdaCmssJsuzlc36n_Tdqw.text: Yes, yes, yes!  For what you pay probably our favorite restaurant in Pittsburgh  Prices are amazing and portions are huge!

onHnlphfCPuQJu0H2JjMiw.text: Food was bad, it took forever, they charged more for a burrito with too much cheese, Beans and rice while the charge less for the same thing but with chicken. They also scammed us by saying we needed to pay a mandatory 25% tip for 40 minutes of waiting and not understanding the staff. Overall it's a shit place.

WCswiPM7-pojYsRJFnbMzw.text: Definitely recommend the fried plantains! Sooo good. Probably one of the most authentic Hispanic food spots in Pittsburgh.. we don't have a ton! Our waitress was very sweet and helpful. Also the prices aren't bad at all.

L8Ps3uqyXD7RomuFUvBqaA.text: I come here once or twice a month and have been since I wrote an initial review back in 2013.  Chicken Latino is consistently putting out simple and well executed food, even if 95% of the time I'm ordering the same thing... tender spiced chicken, expertly seasoned rice and beans, and hot 'n crispy fried yucca.  Pair that with the aji picante (and a spot of mayo mixed in for the yucca... still great even though they changed mayo packet brands recently) and you've been filled with some unbelievable food for $10-15.  If ever I do venture into the restaurant world, I can only hope to achieve the consistency and quality that I've experienced time and again.  See you again this weekend...

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. food of the gods. that bottle was empty in ten minutes time...

yEf14L6qfnfzkQlvp3bJSQ.text: This place is like Nando's peri peri.. i like the chicken and sauce it came with!! Everything was great and one suggestion would be if they can have more sauces it would be even better!!

9X8jTHFPvaWhyjJDxtChRQ.text: My family comes here weekly and we love it. My personal favorite is the lomo saltado. The owner and staff are super friendly.

2b_RSWFwsG3VahFc2e1elg.text: So good. Fast friendly service. The chicken burrito was delicious and their rotisserie chicken is nice and tender. Price is great and portion is more than enough.

4vkKxbxsd47Aon89IqWDDg.text: I have walked past Chicken Latino literally hundreds of times. It is usually overshadowed by two of my favorite food establishments in the strip which just so happen to be directly across the street: Pamelas and Edgars taco stand. This is probably the main reason I have never been to this establishment until recently. But that all changed when my sister and her husband (who are also foodies) kept talking about this "Chicken Latino" place. They explained to me where it was and it finally hit me, it's the colorful place across the street from my two favorite places to eat in the strip, no wonder I haven't ever been there!   They told me to get the chicken burrito and yukka fries, then to mix the green sauce with mayo and put it on everything. This is exactly what I ordered, plus plantains because who doesn't love plantains?!?!   The food came out extremely fast and extremely hot. I was blown away by the size of the portions. "This can't be?" I thought to myself... this food has to be more expensive... NOPE! You get gigantic portions for extremely reasonable prices that all taste wonderful!   The chicken burrito was one of the best I've ever had. The yukka fries were so unique and tasty, they were fluffy and crunchy, salty and savory, like nothing I have ever had before! The plantains were cooked to perfection and on the sweeter side. I usually NEVER leave food on the table but this time I had to. So I boxed up the rest of my plantains and yukka fries and took them home which happened to taste even better later on!   I can't believe I waited so long to go to this place! From now on I'm going to have to spin in a circle in the middle of 21st street with my finger out and whichever of my 3 favorite strip districs restaurants I land on will be where I eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. One of my favorite meals!
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Quesadilla the size of the basket! Yukka fries are a must!
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Soft, sweet plantains!

V9rk_qY7Xn5eK1gMFusoVw.text: Taste-wise, they deserve five stars. But the issue I have is that it's just not enough food for the price. Like, I'm not asking for more meat... but give me more than a spoonful of Spanish rice PLEASE!  ...speaking of which, the rice and beans are amazing considering their simplicity.  But BEWARE... that cold, green sauce they give you when you sit down is super spicy! I underestimated it.

pusY-7Pq0Di7wITMCP24ww.text: Delicious chicken, clean wholesome food and the plantains are amazing! Fast service and a good place for a lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

9oOCTSd0spb8OtOzBctRww.text: This is such a hidden gem in the Strip. It's SO cheap, the serving sizes are huge (so are cheese portions ) and EVERYTHING is good! For those who might feel intimidated by Peruvian cuisine, they also have Mexican dishes (like quesadillas and burritos), and even burgers and fries!   My favorites are the rottisserie chicken, the giant fried chicken burrito (they're not lying about the giant part) and Yucca fries. And don't forget the green chilli sauce!   I also love that they're BYOB and have a few sidewalk tables.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken burrito
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried chicken burrito with grilled veggies.

TLj4r_vxFHsoO_fxogZOnA.text: You know a place is doing well when you come in and they're completely out of what they're known for. In this case, it's their Peruvian-Style Rotisserie Chicken.   Came here on a Sunday and we were lucky enough to get the last quarter of a chicken that they had. We did come here later in the afternoon, a little before they were to close. Along with the chicken, we also ordered the Slow Roasted Pork and Fried Plantains. What makes this chicken different from other rotisserie chicken is the herbs and spices as well as the cooking method. Apparently the juices drippings of the chicken create a steam that cooks the chicken and keeps it moist. After a taste, I would say that that was True. Incredibly moist and flavorful, slightly spicy, The slow roasted pork was also moist and flavorful and great alongside the green hot sauce they have at each table. The pork came with two sides which were rather ordinary. Fried plantains were perfectly sweet and crisp, yet soft. Just how I like it.  The restaurant was rather casual with some outdoor tables. Food was great and I would definitely come back. My one critique was that I felt rather rushed. Yes, we did come in when they were preparing to close but that still wasn't a reason to make customers feel unwanted considering we ordered and finished our meals well before they closed. Though I am really glad they accommodated us anyway, even if it was obligatory.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Inca Kola
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 1/4 Chicken
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Outdoor menu

MaLtV93ZjA5BR_Hy8WNL5Q.text: This is my favorite Peruvian place in PGH. It's always good. They never disappoint. The food quality is always the same. Never a bad experience in this restaurant.

z_zQCLSQB0RimWGlQrLdFg.text: I went here for lunch today with my daughter. Very warm, friendly atmosphere. Very good affordable food that is generous in portions. Only issue was my chair was very unsturdy and had to change it out. Ill definitely be going back!

44Wuve1S3Lt-BKZxV1cgTA.text: I would have loved to try to eat here, however I stood at the register for 10 minutes, Was finally approached by the woman standing at the counter who had been standing there watching him for 10 minutes, and told me it was too busy to take my order. She said give her a minute. I gave her three minutes while she stood there doing nothing, so I walked out and left. At the very least, take my order.

mbJliVgeqvxCRnIyoQ6Q6A.text: Met a friend for lunch here today, and I'll definately return! We arrived a few minutes before they open at 11:00AM, but the hostess saw us and opened the door right away. I hadn't seen my old military buddy for a while, and the server was very patient with our taking time to order because we were sitting there jaw-jacking. Iced tea came out quick. Once we did order - I had a steak burrito with all the fixings, it was hot, fresh, bigger'n heck and tasted great. My buddy ordered a chicken something something, and he enjoyed his lunch as well. Terrific food! The service was friendly, efficient and thorougj. The food was really, really good. The restaurant was clean, well maintained, and it's easy to see why all the tables were busy in no time flat.  Great place to stop in the Strip...I'll definately be back!

N4hplBgj3OjoEed4999oag.text: Chicken Latino is also called Pollo Pollo and a couple of other names though I'm not sure why. Their specialty is Peruvian Chicken. Its similar to a roasted chicken but their chicken comes with better sides. They have a spicy green sauce that makes your tongue sizzle.  They have fries and coleslaw but for more authentic flavor go for the rice and been. They also have sweet potato fries and plantains. Lots of yummy choices. Our family of for got a family meal with a whole roasted chicken, fries and coleslaw for $20. We added family size sides of rice and beans. I should have taken a picture of our empty plates. They do have desserts but we were stuffed. The chicken is so moist and juicy that you want to get every tiny piece off the bones. I know another chicken establishment has the saying of "finger licking good" but Chicken Latinos' is even better.  They have burritos and quesadillas on their menu as well as several drink options. I like the mango soda. They have a nice selection of appetizers. The service and delivery of the food to your table is quick. You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ADyF6urr3lWVqWWILsoc-g.text: Love, love, love this place! The food was so good. I had the lomo saltado. It was definitely enough food for two people. Delicious, perfectly cooked & seasoned. I highly recommend this place!

4DraTNmWbTADlnRe-SN-Ag.text: Hands down, one of my favorite places in Pittsburgh.  Chicken Latino is cheap and delicious.  I love it.  The first trip here I ordered a chicken burrito.  The chicken is excellent, and the burrito was packed with rice and beans.  It was absolutely massive as well, and I think it was $5.  I was a bit disappointed to find out that they charge $.50 each for red salsa and sour cream but don't tell you that.  Nonetheless, this burrito is sensational.  But the 5 star point at Chicken Latino is the green sauce.  It is mouth-watering, spicy, amazingness in a cup.  I have serious cravings for this stuff, and it is the absolute best thing in the world.  If you are on a budget and in the Strip, this is the place to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Burrito and salsa... $6.15 w tax

8jI6Sw3lkUoD93Hj7aI3yQ.text: One of the best restaurant in town! The food is so good and the service is excellent. The food is ready quickly and the servings are big. We had the Lomito Saltado, the Pernil and some yuca & sweet plantain. We'll definitely come back next time we are in town!!!!

2Wv-g2x4hYGekHQ0V8VPfQ.text: How have I not reviewed this place?  I'm in here at least once a month with friends. This spot is a hidden gem in the Strip District area of Pittsburgh.  Their specialty is Peruvian roasted chicken.  I usually snag the roasted chicken with black beans and rice or a soft chicken burrito. The chicken is tender, full of flavor, and melts in your mouth. The black beans are killer and definitely a great option. The rice is what you'd expect.  If you love spicy the housemade tomatillo salsa is for you. They do offer a red salsa that might be an extra charge.   Prices and service are great here.

64x6GQP8dIdwUMEanuTzcw.text: people rave about this place and i've meant to go, but there are so many tempting choices in the Strip that I only recently made it here.  juicy Peruvian chicken is the name of the game here, served up with an enormous heap of hot, fresh steak fries and a cup of coleslaw (you can also get rice/beans). 1/2 chicken was plenty for myself and a friend to share. It's not Nando's Peri-Peri (a la DC) but it's close enough for Pittsburgh and reasonably priced.  the fried plantains were a perfectly caramelized addition (side and appetizer are the same, just depends when you want it to come out)  service was adequate - we did need to go to the counter a few times to ask for things we needed (water, condiments) but they were friendly enough for a casual spot.   tips: mix the green sauce with mayo to cool it down! it balances out the spice with creaminess that works well with both chicken and fries!

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sweet Fried Plantains
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 1/2 Chicken with Fries and Coleslaw

KYeq9AIPWfdA0iwVoZ351Q.text: WOW. Loveeeeeeee this place. We came here for lunch an a Saturday afternoon.  I'm new around the Pittsburgh area and I have been hardcore searching for an authentic, legit Latin restaurant that reminds me of my roots. And this is the place! Now this is a seat yourself type of place, but I've never had any issues getting a table.  When I went I got the Ceviche which was fresh and very flavorful and my boyfriend got the rotisserie chicken with rice and beans. The rotisserie chicken is soo good! So moist and full of flavor and that spicy green sauce puts it over the edge! It tastes incredible! This is officially my go to spot when I'm in the strip district.   So happy I came across this gem! The portions are very good for the price, and the cost is very affordable and reasonable. Definitely a must try in the area! Just wish they had natural juices or made their own.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Menu
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 1/4 Chicken with Rice and Beans
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ceviche(regular)

w4rtcfeHiUBT6cb1uCX5iw.text: Nice find while walking around the open air market. We were seated right away and split the 1/2 chicken with rice and beans. We also had an order for plantains. The chicken was seasoned nicely and very moist. The rice and beans were tasty mixed together. I loved the plantains!! Reasonably priced as well. The sauce on the table was spicy, but good.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sweet Fried Plantains
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Inside
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Half 1/2 Chicken with Rice and Beans

8HBKfx8bwtmufv_MJ81knQ.text: The star of the show here is the spicy green chili sauce. As a spice lover, that sauce made the experience that much better. This place isn't upscale by any means, but it has what you could possibly need. Good food, fast service, and reasonable prices.  CRISPY YUCA ($5.99): Yuca french fries. I think a bit too crispy but they did serve it to us fresh and hot, lightly salted. Tasty with ketchup and the green sauce!!! 1/2 CHICKEN W/ RICE & COLESLAW ($7.99): Pretty good. Honestly tastes like your average, juicy rotisserie chicken. But I'll say it was my first time having ~Peruvian~ chicken and they made it a delicious experience :)! Rice was yummy and definitely needed if you're having the green sauce too. Coleslaw to cool it down a bit.   They didn't have the ceviche that day (winter time, less people so they didn't get ingredients around that time) which was so disappointing so maybe when I come back and have that it'll bump up to a 5.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 1/2 chicken with rice and cole slaw on two plates
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

am5j2mM15p0uK5OvM5gSgg.text: This place is amazing. I had the 1/2 chicken with beans & rice. Simply amazing. Better yet was my buddies burrito which was humungous and my other buddies chicken salad  which was enough for 3 people.  There had to be a pound of chicken on his salad. The staff is super friendly and cordial. I highly recommend eating here for lunch or dinner.

VH_yzBqIpWI0eZI2oAxO4Q.text: Used to be a favorite place of mine for great Peruvian food but the service has dropped off significantly. Staff are very disengaged and miserable most of the time. The place needs a clean up. Seats are sticky.  Food quality is ok but not the same as from a year or so ago. Yucca fries are a delicacy but needs to be cooked precisely to ensure it's not undercooked and crispy on the outside. Price point is great. They just need to find their mojo and enthusiasm for customer service and focus on ensuring the quality of food remains high.

90sAQowHtD2dOpMZZK_KTw.text: Recommend going here for the affordable prices, fun and festive ambiance, friendly customer service and of course the delicious selection of Mexican and Peruvian food!   Together we shared a vegetarian quesadilla, fried plantains, Peruvian chicken, rice & beans, chicha limena & passion fruit drinks. The plantains were warm, crispy, sweet and comforting. The chicken was especially tasty and may have been my favorite part of the meal. I also loved the crispy vegetarian quesadilla with the the creamy black beans, fluffy rice, melty cheese, & salsa for added freshness. It's nice to have the choice of a vegetarian option that is both satisfying and well balanced. We also really enjoyed the exotic juices as they added an interesting flavor and were not too sweet. Our friend ordered the "Pittsburgh style" chicken salad loaded with shredded cheese and fries. Although the salad had a generous portion it was a bit heavy on the fries and cheese based on my observation of it.  We definitely plan to come back here again and are excited to try some of the other traditional foods on the menu such as the yuca fries and seviche. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

0mOMhk0zgscgTjS6Mcp3QQ.text: This is excellent food at an excellent value. I love the seasoning of the chicken. I have never eaten here in person but when I order food it come quickly and one time. I also love their yucca and that it comes with SO MUCH! It is good Hispanic mother portions and flavor!

uuwWZgk9i1UjtgQs5GCMew.text: This place is kind of tucked away off of Penn and definitely doesn't have the flare or ambiance of some of the places on the Strip, but for quick and affordable, this is the place! They've got burgers and burritos but I'd recommend getting a half chicken. It's flavorful and juicy and hits the spot. For the two of us we shared a fried plantain appetizer, the half chicken with fries and coleslaw and a tres leches cake to top it off! Before tip we were at $24 bucks. Pretty inexpensive and tasty date night :)

TdIVhzMly5AmFyAyvS9NYA.text: It is a pretty small space. It got packed pretty quickly during the lunch hour on Wednesday. Despite the crowd, we ordered and were served within about 10 minutes. Food was decent. I got the chicken quesadilla-biggest quesadilla I've ever had. I ate about half and took the other half home. It was tasty, but it was nothing special. They have a spicy cilantro sauce they bring to the table, and it is incredible- it definitely gave the quesadilla the extra flair it was needing. I  presume the Peruvian cuisine is much better than their Mexican cuisine since they specialize in it. Next time, I will be trying something from that side. Overall, the food is mediocre, the staff is very sweet, and the service is good.

photos.caption: Photo of Chicken Latino - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

ZNVJj8Zb-Pole1K4O98pxA.text: This is my first time here. I came here for team lunch with my colleagues. I found this place very interesting. We ordered 2 full Chicken with fries and coleslaw. It didn't took so much time for them to serve. It was quick. Chicken was well cooked and the sauce is spicy and chicken tasted awesome with the sauce. Definitely recommended. Guys try this restaurant when ever you're here. Here are some pics
